newsitem.title: SWEDEN: FORECAST-Swedish Sept c/a surplus 4.8 bln SKR.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Swedish Sept c/a surplus 4.8 bln SKR.

text.p: Sweden's current account is expected to show a surplus of 4.8 billion crowns in September, a poll of 14 analysts showed on Friday.

Forecasts ranged from surpluses of 3.9 billion crowns to 5.6 billion. For full year 1996, analysts forecast an average surplus of 51 billion crowns, with responses ranging from 45 to 61 billion crowns, a poll of 11 analysts showed.
The January-August current account surplus was 39 billion crowns and if the forecast for September is fulfilled the nine-month surplus will increase to almost 44 billion crowns.
In August the current account surplus was 4.6 billion crowns and in September 1995 it was 5.1 billion crowns.
Sweden's central bank, the Riksbank, is due to publish the figure on November 19 at 1100 GMT.

Sources in the survey were Carnegie, Consensus, Den Danske Bank, Hagstromer & Qviberg, Handelsbanken, HSBC Midland, J P Morgan, Lehman Brothers, Nordbanken, Sparbanken, Transferator, Union Bank of Switzerland, Unibank Markets and Ohmans.
